pros: Great students who make teaching very rewarding!

review_title: It seems to be a good workplace but....
job_title: Assistant Graphic Designer in Houston, TX
pros: The environment seems fun at the beginning and there will be a lot to learn.
cons: Nobody appreciates the work you do even If you work hard. Plus, they don't care about the employees' health safety, especially since the campus is very old and there's mold everywhere. Not a good place for people who have asthma or allergies.

pros: Its 24/7, you can pick up lots of shifts

review_title: Promising but be weary of HR
pros: Great location in the heart of Montrose. Long holiday breaks. Peaceful campus. Adequate education. Tuition benefits. Exciting growth with new programs, project and business structure. Pretty relaxed environment in general.
cons: Do not trust HR. Known as "Handsy Randy" for inappropriate touching of personnel.

pros: Very friendly faculty and staff to work with, excellent benefits
cons: Extremely conservative values - they're not pushy about it though, also what one would expect at a Catholic University

pros: UST is mission driven and engaged within the community
cons: There are no cons at this time

pros: There is the opportunity to continue your education, or your kids' or spouse's through education benefits. And you get a nice set of paid holidays. The culture is great particularly if you are Catholic, the people are generally very nice.
cons: Depending on your department and position you may not have time to pursue your education benefits, at least not for yourself. Some departments are understaffed and you may end up performing the duties of several jobs while only being paid for one. There are not as many opportunities for advancement as it may first appear, once you are in a position it is difficult to move to another or get an increase in pay based upon what you are actually doing even if it is a lot more than you were first hired for.

pros: Plenty of vacation if you don't need to teach summer school to make ends meet. Small classes.
cons: No raises for faculty in a long time. Faculty members are expected to do it all without resources or support. Those faculty members who can leave are leaving. New president is trying to turn things around, but no evidence that things are improving yet. Some of the administrators are paid way too much given their demonstrated skill sets.  Rivalries between some departments are toxic.

pros: It is a fun place to work. The students are respectful. My colleagues are encouraging.
cons: The school, as every other one in the nation, does not have the funding to hire full time faculty.

review_title: People grow, educate themselves, and become aware, knowledgable and better human beings.The University is compassionate.
pros: Efficient, kind, empathetic, helps people to grow one at a time.  Makes sure students are treated equally be they either male or female, race religion or financial status.
cons: The University could be more spacious, some of the visiting Instructors are uncaring for students; unlike the full/part time instructors and the tutoring center could be more efficient in its services.

pros: They waive one class for you if you are a graduate assistant. You only need to work 12 hours a week. If you work over 12 hours a week, they will pay you over time, which is 7.25/hour. Sometimes, you will have free lunch and some leftover to bring home.
cons: You need to deal with some tough students' requests. Sometimes, they will ask you to pick up food and set up a room for their faculty meeting.

pros: Free Education, Great people Staff and Faculty, Great work life balance.  Education is a priory in most departments Great education
cons: Some politics, insurance is expensive, almost half your monthly. Low pay Some Catholic values will hinder some basic medical needs for women.

pros:
Small financial department- 5 people total 
Small community of students, engagement is personable and very hospitable among the ust community. 
Free tuition for employees
cons:
Corruption 
Play favorites with students. For example; had list on a first come bases to award BeonTimeLoans, favorite students would be awarded these loans. Why bother have a list.
Scholarships were a joke. Money was given to HR employee's children but not other students who needed assistance. Since employee children were given free tuition, that scholarship money was pocketed. 
Unethical place to work.
